page.title: 13COMMUNITY FARM - ANIMALS
page.content: The farm has two pedigree Jersey heifers and there is herd of 21 Fresian/cross Hereford and one Hereford. There is a flock of 47 sheep which will be sheared every year, usually in the third or fourth week in May, and the wool sold to the Welsh Wool Marketing Board in Brecon. There are also 5 breeding nanny goats and King is the only horse on the farm. He is a four-year-old Welsh Cob or light workhorse. The farm has a boar which is a Large White breed and also two sows of the same type. In the paddock next to the farmyard, there are 110 Rhode Island Red laying hens producing eggs each day which are sold at the farm. Other than the Llamas, all the animals are bred, bought and sold on a commercial basis.
